reviews.text: I've travelled from this station since 2001, and since THE lovely and late Lenny died in 2017, this station is not managed in the same way as before. It has a new cafe and new self serve machine, but its lost the human touch and is not a station that many would want to stop off at as a result.
Small station next to Myddleton Road and a few minutes walk to Bounds Green station (Piccadilly line). There is a manned counter but this isn't open all of the time, and a few ticket machines.

Peaceful station with easy connection to Moorgate (during week) or Kings Cross (weekend). 

A little cafe selling great coffee and pastries recently opened on the platform. Myddleton Road high street with many independent stores is adjacent to the station. Tickets can be purchased on a vending machine or at a booth that is staffed in the mornings. 

The Bounds Green tube stop is a 5 minute walk away for catching the Piccadilly Line. Good to have two travel options on the rare occasion that a morning train into the city is cancelled. 

It is easy to get a spot on the morning trains, unlike stations that are closer to the city. I very much prefer commuting on the train from this station over using the crowded and dark subway. It has greatly improved my life in London.
Nice small station, with a small café
